abstractText: The number of selected salmonid age classesreflects the suitability and stability of conditionsfor spawning, rearing, and maturation. Stressors (exploitation, recruitment failure, food limitation, niche shifts) often cause a shift in age-class distributions. The method refers to selected salmonids because it focuses on theredd building, gravel-spawning species, such as Chinook and steelhead. This metric is also used to develop an index for biotic integrity (IBI) applicable to fish assemblages in coldwater riversthroughout the Pacific Northwest.
title: Determination of selected salmonid age-classes v1.0
